item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "God created war so that Americans would learn geography." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The secret to getting ahead is getting started." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "A learning experience is one of those things that says, 'You know that thing you just did? Don't do that." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The quality of any advice anybody has to offer has to be judged against the quality of life they actually lead." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "Wisdom cannot be imparted. Wisdom that a wise man attempts to impart always sounds like foolishness to someone else ... Knowledge can be communicated, but not wisdom. One can find it, live it, do wonders through it, but one cannot communicate and teach it." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "Opinions mean nothing; they may be beautiful or ugly, clever or foolish, anyone can embrace or reject them." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "This must be Thursday,' said Arthur to himself, sinking low over his beer. 'I never could get the hang of Thursdays." -- Douglas Adams
